commenter_a: I live abroad, and there is no escaping questions about Donald Trump on an almost daily basis. I'm often asked directly, "He's not actually going to be President, though, is he? Can he be? Why are people supporting him?" They think Americans have lost their minds, and there's tangible concern about what his presidency could mean for the world. Fortunately, I keep FiveThirtyEight handy and can show them how unlikely (currently) his election is, but American democracy has taken a huge (yuge?) credibility hit regardless.
post_message: When your vacation turns into a lesson in "Trump-splaining."
